> Did you try the same thing with x3 being all 1's?  It may just be
that
> the network needs a bias (i.e. an input with a constant value) in
> order to solve XOR.

No I haven't but it's a good idea, thank you. As for biases thay are
defined in run-time. "Hang" neurons (that don't have inputs) can
appear but as log-sigmoid activation function is used then their
output is not zero and constant. Although solutions without biases
are also possible.

>  Also, did it work without x3, with only 2 inputs?

Yes it worked without x3.
